cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles ENE of Great Abaco Island, north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Turning WNW tonight, then NW on Thursday, and north to north-northeast on Friday while crossing the Florida Peninsula, entering the northeastern Gulf briefly, and moving inland across Georgia and the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near or just north of West Palm Beach, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Hallandale Beach–Boca Raton FL and Lake Okeechobee; Storm Surge Watch Ochlockonee River–Indian Pass FL and N Palm Beach–Hallandale Beach FL; Tropical Storm Watch south of Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef FL.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Abacos, Berry Is., Grand Bahama; Boca Raton–Flagler/Volusia Co. line FL.  Tropical Storm Warning Bimini; Hallandale Beach FL–South Santee River SC; north of Bonita Beach–Indian Pass FL.  Storm Surge Warning North Palm Beach FL–Altamaha Sound GA, St. Johns River, Anclote River–Ochlockonee River FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Bahamas, most of the Florida Peninsula (both Atlantic and portions of Gulf sides), Georgia and South Carolina coasts, with wind and surge extending into northeast Gulf of Mexico.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds; breezy northeasterly gusts possible Thursday night–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Alabama coast; surge focus remains east of the Big Bend.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Thursday night into Friday as the system’s western rain shield brushes southern Alabama.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents in the open Gulf; minor schedule disruptions from rain-bands.
